metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 21 axioms covering belief, knowledge, inference, justification, graded belief, assumptions, and mutual belief
metadata.notation: First-order logic with extensive defeasible reasoning, cognitive states, and epistemic concepts

axioms.title: Represent Argument Constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (c e a) (if (represent c e a) (and (concept c) (eventuality e) (agent a))))
axioms.english: The represent relation holds between concepts, eventualities, and agents.

axioms.title: Believe0 Requires Representation
axioms.fol: (forall (a c) (if (believe0 a c) (exists (e) (represent c e a))))
axioms.english: If an agent believes a concept, then there is an eventuality that the concept represents for the agent.

axioms.title: Believe Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (a e) (iff (believe a e) (or (and (concept e)(believe0 a e)) (and (eventuality e) (exists (c) (and (represent c e a)(believe0 a c)))))))
axioms.english: Belief takes an agent and either a concept or an eventuality (coerced to its corresponding concept).

axioms.title: Belief and Conjunction
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 e2 e3) (if (and' e1 e2 e3) (and (if (and (believe a e1)(etc)) (and (believe a e2)(believe a e3))) (if (and (believe a e2)(believe a e3)(etc)) (believe a e1)))))
axioms.english: We believe a conjunction exactly when we believe the conjuncts (defeasibly).

axioms.title: Believing a Set
axioms.fol: (forall (a s) (if (and (agent a)(eventualities s)) (iff (believe a s) (forall (e)(if (member e s)(believe a e))))))
axioms.english: To believe a set of eventualities is to believe each member of the set.

axioms.title: Defeasible Consistency
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 e2) (if (and (believe a e1) (not' e2 e1) (etc)) (not (believe a e2))))
axioms.english: People defeasibly do not believe contradictions - if they believe e1 and e2 is the negation of e1, they typically don't believe e2.

axioms.title: Defeasible Modus Ponens
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 e2 e3) (if (and (imply' e1 e2 e3) (believe a e2) (believe a e1) (etc)) (believe a e3)))
axioms.english: Defeasibly, we can do modus ponens in belief contexts - if we believe P and believe P implies Q, we generally believe Q.

axioms.title: Universal Instantiation in Belief
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 e2 e3) (if (and (partialInstance' e1 e2 e3)(believe a e3) (believe a e1) (etc)) (believe a e2)))
axioms.english: Defeasibly, agents can do universal instantiation - if they believe a generalization and believe the instantiation conditions, they believe the instance.

axioms.title: Perception Causes Belief
axioms.english: Perceiving is defeasibly believing - what we perceive, we typically believe.

axioms.title: Beliefs Influence Action
axioms.fol: (forall (a) (if (agent a) (exists (e1 e2) (and (if (believe a e1)(will a e2)) (if (not (believe a e1))(not (will a e2)))))))
axioms.english: There exist beliefs and actions such that believing influences willing - beliefs affect what agents will to do.

axioms.title: Knowledge as True Belief
axioms.fol: (forall (a e) (if (know a e) (and (believe a e)(Rexist e))))
axioms.english: Knowledge requires both belief and truth - if an agent knows something, they believe it and it really exists.

axioms.title: Knowledge as Justified True Belief
axioms.fol: (forall (a e) (iff (know a e) (and (believe a e)(Rexist e) (exists (s) (and (soundlyJustify s e a)(Rexist s))))))
axioms.english: Knowledge is justified true belief with true justification - belief, truth, sound justification, and the justification premises are also true.

axioms.title: Learning Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (a e) (iff (learn a e) (exists (e1) (and (know' e1 a e)(changeTo e1)))))
axioms.english: Learning is a change into a state of knowledge.

axioms.title: Realizing Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (a e) (iff (realize a e) (and (learn a e) (exists (e1 s e2) (and (or (perceive' e1 a e)(infer' e1 a e s)) (know' e2 a e)(cause e1 e2))))))
axioms.english: To realize something is to learn it by inference or perception - realizing is learning caused by perceiving or inferring.

axioms.title: Mutual Belief Argument Constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (c e) (if (mb c e) (and (set c)(forall (a) (if (member a c)(agent a))) (eventuality e))))
axioms.english: Mutual belief is a relation between a set of agents and an eventuality.

axioms.title: Mutual Belief Implies Individual Belief
axioms.fol: (forall (c e a) (if (and (mb c e)(member a c)) (believe a e)))
axioms.english: If a community mutually believes something, then each member believes it.

axioms.title: Mutual Belief Reflection
axioms.fol: (forall (c e) (if (mb c e) (exists (e1) (and (mb c e1)(mb' e1 c e)))))
axioms.english: If a community mutually believes something, they mutually believe that they mutually believe it - mutual belief reflects on itself.

axioms.title: Copresence Implies Mutual Belief
axioms.english: Copresence defeasibly entails mutual belief - if agents are copresent at an event, they typically mutually believe it occurred.

conversion_notes.first_psychology_chapter: First chapter in Part III focusing specifically on cognitive psychological phenomena
conversion_notes.extensive_defeasibility: 22 axioms use (etc) for defeasible reasoning - more than any previous chapter
conversion_notes.belief_as_central: Belief as fundamental cognitive relation with extensive logical properties
conversion_notes.concept_eventuality_distinction: Systematic treatment of difference between mental concepts and world eventualities
conversion_notes.graded_belief_theory: Sophisticated treatment of degrees of belief using likelihood scales from Chapter 20
conversion_notes.inference_modes: Systematic coverage of deduction, abduction, and induction as inference types
conversion_notes.justification_theory: Complex taxonomy of justification types (sound, partial, circular, poor)
conversion_notes.mutual_belief_framework: Foundation for shared knowledge and common ground in communities
conversion_notes.belief_revision: Integration with AI belief revision literature and AGM postulates
conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Extensive use of primed predicates for cognitive states and processes

file_format_notes.axiom_selection: Sample of 18 key axioms representing major concepts - full chapter contains 112 axioms
file_format_notes.section_coverage: Covers belief objects, belief properties, belief revision, graded belief, assumptions, inference, justification, knowledge, and mutual belief
file_format_notes.complexity_justification: Complex axioms involve multiple nested quantifiers, cognitive processes, or sophisticated epistemic definitions
file_format_notes.pattern_focus: Emphasizes defeasible rules, definitions, and logical implications characteristic of cognitive psychology
file_format_notes.predicate_summary: Chapter introduces 55+ new predicates for epistemic concepts and cognitive processes
